description: From Middle English evenlight, evenelyȝth, from Old English ǣfenlēoht (“evening light”), equivalent to even +‎ light. Cognate with Dutch avondlicht (“evening light”), German Abendlicht (“evening light”).

examples: When a little child lies in your arms at night, What do you care for care; When her little lips sing in the evenlight, And her little arms clasp you there?
